title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

The entropy change is positive because the reaction has one mole of gas in the products and none in the reactants.
descriptions:
Student earns 0/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

The entropy change is positive because the reaction has one mole of gas in the products and none in the reactants.

Student earns 1/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

The entropy change is positive because the reaction has one mole of gas in the products and none in the reactants.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct calculation of the value of ΔH° .

ΔH° = 3(-101) + 90. +2(-286) - 4(-207)

= 43 kJ/molrxn
descriptions:
Student earns 0/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct calculation of the value of ΔH° .

ΔH° = 3(-101) + 90. +2(-286) - 4(-207)

= 43 kJ/molrxn

Student earns 1/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct calculation of the value of ΔH° .

ΔH° = 3(-101) + 90. +2(-286) - 4(-207)

= 43 kJ/molrxn

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

ΔG° = ΔH° - TΔS°

The reaction is more likely to be favorable at 95°C. At the higher temperature, the term TΔS° is larger and positive; thus, when subtracted from ΔH°, the value of ΔG° is more likely to be negative.
descriptions:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a valid method.

The student can evaporate the water, leaving behind solid silver nitrate.
